intro: Colymbada sibthorpii, commonly known as the Sibthorp's colymbada, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Colymbada sibthorpii is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions.
